key_problems.text: Subdural hematoma and comminuted fractures of the occipital bone
key_problems.source: [CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM] section, chunk_1:1600-1629; [SKELETAL SYSTEM] section, chunk_2:1684-1735

pertinent_history.text: Not pregnant at the time of death

objective_findings.text: Cold and unembalmed with declining rigor
Pronounced unblanching lividity on the posterior of the body
Skull symmetric with extensive trauma in the occipital region
objective_findings.source: [CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM] section, chunk_1:1600-1634; [SKELETAL SYSTEM] section, chunk_2:1684-1715

objective_findings.text: Subdural hematoma and comminuted fractures of the occipital bone with numerous bone fragments penetrating brain tissue
objective_findings.source: [SKELETAL SYSTEM] section, chunk_2:1684-1735; [DESCRIPTION OF INJURIES - SUMMARY] section, chunk_8:3645-3690

objective_findings.text: Mucosa of the epiglottis, glottis, piriform sinuses, trachea and major bronchi are anatomic
Esophagus mucosa intact and gray-pink without lesions or injuries
Stomach contains approximately 125 ml of partially digested semisolid food
Kidneys weigh left 115 grams and right 113 grams
Female genital system within normal limits
Time of death between 9:30 p.m. on 9/17/05 and 12:00 a.m. on 9/18/05
